name: Farengar Secret-Fire

aspects.trouble: Obsessed with Knowledge, Blind to Danger
other_aspects: Former Student of the College of Winterhold
Collector of Rare Tomes and Artifacts

stunts: Magical Scholar: +2 to Lore when researching ancient magic or dragons
Enchanting Expertise: +2 to Crafts when creating or analyzing magical items
Arcane Connections: Can locate rare magical texts and artifacts through network of contacts
notes: Farengar Secret-Fire is the court wizard of Whiterun, serving Jarl Balgruuf. A former student of the College of Winterhold, he's brilliant but arrogant, often dismissive of non-mages. He's currently obsessed with researching dragons and has been investigating reports of dragon sightings. His academic approach sometimes blinds him to practical dangers. He values knowledge above almost everything else and maintains connections with various magical organizations, including some of dubious reputation.
combat_tactics: Farengar uses destruction magic and defensive wards but lacks real combat experience. He's more likely to freeze in actual danger than his confident demeanor suggests. In a fight, he relies on raw magical power rather than tactics.

starting_equipment.weapon: Spell Tome (Weapon:2, can cast various spells)

social_interaction: Farengar is condescending and impatient with those he considers intellectually inferior, which is most people. He speaks rapidly about his research, assuming others understand complex magical concepts. With fellow scholars, he's more collegial but still competitive. He often interrupts with 'interesting' observations. Despite his poor social skills, he's genuinely passionate about his work.

relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Employer, provides funding for research in exchange for magical services
relationships.Irileth: Housecarl, she finds him annoying but useful
relationships.Tolfdir: Former instructor at College, respects his knowledge
relationships.Delphine: Secret contact providing information about dragons (unaware she's Blade)

personality_notes.speaking_style: Rapid, technical, condescending, uses complex terms unnecessarily, frequently says 'fascinating'
personality_notes.character_growth: May learn to value practical wisdom, appreciate warriors' contributions, develop humility through crisis

dragon_research.current_focus: Investigating dragon sightings and ancient dragon lore
dragon_research.key_lead: Believes Bleak Falls Barrow contains Dragonstone with dragon burial locations
dragon_research.contact: Receiving information from mysterious source in Riverwood (Delphine)
dragon_research.theory: Dragons returning is connected to ancient prophecy and magic
dragon_research.obsession: Will risk almost anything to obtain dragon knowledge
dragon_research.blindspot: Doesn't realize how dangerous dragons actually are

bleak_falls_barrow_mission.objective: Recover the Dragonstone from Bleak Falls Barrow
bleak_falls_barrow_mission.importance: Map showing ancient dragon burial sites across Skyrim
bleak_falls_barrow_mission.urgency: Increased with recent dragon sightings and activity
bleak_falls_barrow_mission.complication: Delphine already sent bandits to retrieve it, but they failed
bleak_falls_barrow_mission.reward: Payment and potential access to Farengar's magical resources

battle_of_whiterun_role.before_battle: Too absorbed in dragon research to notice civil war escalation
battle_of_whiterun_role.during_battle: Continues research even as fighting begins, eventually must evacuate or defend Dragonsreach
battle_of_whiterun_role.magical_support: Can provide limited magical assistance to defenders if forced
battle_of_whiterun_role.priority: Protecting his research and book collection above all else
battle_of_whiterun_role.player_interaction: If PC arrives on College mission, Farengar enlists their help with Dragonstone just as battle erupts

story_hooks: Gives PC mission to retrieve Dragonstone from Bleak Falls Barrow
Connects PC to dragon investigation main quest
Can provide magical item identification and enchanting services
Source of information about ancient magic and dragons
May request PC recover rare books or artifacts
Connection to Delphine and Blades storyline

dialogue_samples.greeting: Yes? What is it? I'm quite busy with important research. Unless you have something actually interesting to share, I'd prefer not to be disturbed.
dialogue_samples.dragon_research: Fascinating, isn't it? Dragons, creatures of legend, returned to Skyrim! The magical implications are extraordinary. I must have that Dragonstone - it's the key to understanding dragon burial sites.
dialogue_samples.college_mission: Ah, the College sent someone? Good. Tolfdir wrote ahead. I could use someone with basic competence. I need you to retrieve an item from Bleak Falls Barrow - a Dragonstone. Simple dungeon crawl for someone of your... practical skills.
dialogue_samples.dismissive: Yes, yes, the civil war. Stormcloaks, Imperials, both trying to kill each other over politics. Meanwhile, dragons have returned, and I'm the only one taking it seriously. Now, if you'll excuse me...
dialogue_samples.during_crisis: What? Battle? Now? But I'm in the middle of critical research! Fine, fine, I'll... secure my notes. Don't let those barbarians damage my library!

neutral_faction_integration.college_start: When Tolfdir sends you to Whiterun, Farengar immediately puts you to work. 'Excellent timing,' he says. 'I need someone capable to retrieve a Dragonstone from Bleak Falls Barrow. Ancient map of dragon burial sites - absolutely critical for my research. The College will want this information.'
neutral_faction_integration.companions_start: Farengar has hired the Companions before for protection on expeditions. When you arrive, he recognizes your affiliation and offers a lucrative job retrieving an ancient artifact.
neutral_faction_integration.thieves_guild_start: If you mention you're working with Olfrid, Farengar becomes interested. He sometimes acquires... questionable... artifacts through such channels.
neutral_faction_integration.transition_to_battle: While Farengar briefs you on the mission, alarms sound. Stormcloak forces are approaching Whiterun. The Battle is beginning, and you must choose sides before you can pursue Farengar's quest.
neutral_faction_integration.consequences: Your choice in the battle affects whether Farengar can continue his research and which faction controls access to dragon information.
